attributes.action: Ensure fair grading for A Level students in 2023
attributes.additional_details:
The 2022/23 A-Level class is the class that lost out on the majority of their GCSE years, (Year 10, 2020 & Year 11, 2021) and this has had a long-term impact on many students. Many current A Level students are struggling as a result of the impact of the pandemic on their GCSE education, and this is hindering AS & A Level performance.
 
We want the Government to work with Ofqual to ensure that A Level students are graded as generously in 2023 as they were in 2022, to reflect the disruption this group has experience.
attributes.background: We want the Government to work with Ofqual to ensure that students are graded as generously in 2023 as they were in 2022, to reflect the disruption caused by covid-19.
